page.title: 07THE CROASDELLS-HOLKER MOSS
page.content: The{Croasdells}have lived in the area since the 15th century and were paupers.Now Mrs.Croasdell owns a small house called "Grassgarth" just south of Bigland Hall Estate.She has lived there for 61 years.In her youth she would play on land owned by the Biglands and was frequently chased off by the patrolling gamekeeper.The only disturbance to the peace now is caused by low-flying military aircraft on training runs.The local dialect describes the land as being "bony" or rough,rocky and uncultivated.Mrs. Croasdell looks at today's youth and believes that children's attitudes have not changed over the years but that they are more restricted in their actions..."when you saw a can you used to kick it,it was the natural thing to do.Nowadays children are brought up being told not to do this and that".
